chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra Prop

Premises:
DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> Join worlds -> Prop
prod_dSA : forall (A B : Type) (R_A : Relation A) (R_B : Relation B) (Join_A : Join A) (Join_B : Join B), DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra A -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra B -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (A * B)
fun_dSA : forall (A B : Type) (R_B : Relation B) (J_B : Join B), DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra B -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (A -> B)
option_disj_dSA : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds), SeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
option_ord_dSA : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra worlds -> IncreasingSeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
monHeap_dSA : forall addr val : Type, DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (Heap addr val)
discHeap_dSA : forall addr val : Type, DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (Heap addr val)
monHeap_dSA' : forall addr val : Type, DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (Heap' addr val)
discHeap_dSA' : forall addr val : Type, DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (Heap' addr val)
discProp_R = fun P Q : Prop => P < -> Q : Relation Prop
UpwardsClosure_DownwardsClosed = fun (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds) (dSA : DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra worlds) (m1 m2 m n1 n2 : worlds) (H : join m1 m2 m) (H0 : Krelation n1 m1) (H1 : Krelation n2 m2) => match H with | ex_intro _ n (conj H3 H4) => let e : exists n0 : worlds, join n1 n2 n0 /\ Krelation n0 n := join_Korder_down m1 m2 n n1 n2 H4 H0 H1 in match e with | ex_intro _ n' (conj H6 H7) => ex_intro (fun n0 : worlds => join n1 n2 n0 /\ Krelation n0 m) n (conj (ex_intro (fun n0 : worlds => Krelation n0 n /\ join n1 n2 n0) n' (conj H7 H6)) H3) end end : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds...
Prop_Join = fun P Q R : Prop => (P \/ Q <-> R) /\ (P -> Q -> False) : Join Prop
ssrbool.prop_in11 : forall T1 T2 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall P : T1 -> T2 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall (x : T1) (y : T2), P x y) -> Prop
residue_extensible : forall e u : ?worlds, residue u e -> exists v : ?worlds, join e u v where ?worlds : [ |- Type] ?R : [ |- Relation ?worlds] ?po_R : [ |- PreOrder Krelation] ?J : [ |- Join ?worlds] ?dSA : [ |- DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
discProp_uSA = ikiM_uSA : UpwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra Prop
ssrbool.inPhantom : forall p : Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop p
residual_extensible : forall u : ?worlds, exists e v : ?worlds, join u e v where ?worlds : [ |- Type] ?R : [ |- Relation ?worlds] ?po_R : [ |- PreOrder Krelation] ?J : [ |- Join ?worlds] ?SA : [ |- SeparationAlgebra ?worlds] ?dSA : [ |- DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra ?worlds] ?resSA : [ |- ResidualSeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
join_Korder_down : forall m1 m2 m n1 n2 : ?worlds, join m1 m2 m -> Krelation n1 m1 -> Krelation n2 m2 -> exists n : ?worlds, join n1 n2 n /\ Krelation n m where ?worlds : [ |- Type] ?R : [ |- Relation ?worlds] ?J : [ |- Join ?worlds] ?DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra : [ |- DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
UpwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> Join worlds -> Prop
Zne = fun x y : Z => x <> y : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
gt = fun n m : nat => (m < n)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Join = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
Z.ge = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
Pos.le = fun x y : positive => (x ?= y)%positive <> Gt : positive -> positive -> Prop Argument scopes are [positive_scope positive_scope]
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
discProp_ikiM = {| Korder_identity := fun (m n : Prop) (H : Krelation m n) => prop_ext m n H |} : IdentityKripkeIntuitionisticModel Prop
unit_dSA = fun (m1 m2 m n1 n2 : Datatypes.unit) (H : join m1 m2 m) (_ : Krelation n1 m1) (_ : Krelation n2 m2) => ex_intro (fun n : Datatypes.unit => join n1 n2 n /\ Krelation n m) tt (conj H (match m as u return (join m1 m2 u -> Krelation tt u) with | tt => fun _ : join m1 m2 tt => reflexivity tt end H)) : DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra Datatypes.unit
Inductive sump_Join : natPlus -> natPlus -> natPlus -> Prop := sump_j : forall x y z : natPlus, (x + y)%nat = z -> sump_Join x y z
Inductive ht_ord : htype -> htype -> Prop := htype_refl : forall x : htype, ht_ord x x | htype_sht1 : ht_ord char short1 | htype_sht2 : ht_ord char short2
Ndigits.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope]
Z.eqf = fun f g : Z -> bool => forall n : Z, f n = g n : (Z -> bool) -> (Z -> bool) -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope]
THvalid = fun TH : nat -> option htype => forall n : nat, TH n = Some short1 < -> TH (S n) = Some short2 : (nat -> option htype) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
join = fun (worlds : Type) (Join : Join worlds) => Join : forall worlds : Type, Join worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop Arguments worlds, Join are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
Inductive sum_Join : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop := sum_j : forall x y z : nat, (x + y)%nat = z -> sum_Join x y z For sum_Join: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope] For sum_j: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope _]
Inductive min_Join : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop := min_j : forall x y z : nat, (z <= x)%nat -> (z <= y)%nat -> min_Join x y z For min_Join: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope] For min_j: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _]
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : (n <= n)%nat | le_S : forall m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (n <= S m)%nat For le: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope] For le_n: Argument scope is [nat_scope] For le_S: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope _]
Record IdentityKripkeIntuitionisticModel (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) : Prop := Build_IdentityKripkeIntuitionisticModel { Korder_identity : forall m n : worlds, Krelation m n -> m = n } For IdentityKripkeIntuitionisticModel: Argument R is implicit and maximally inserted For IdentityKripkeIntuitionisticModel: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For Build_IdentityKripkeIntuitionisticModel: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ function_scope]
Record IncreasingSeparationAlgebra (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds) : Prop := Build_IncreasingSeparationAlgebra { all_increasing : forall x : worlds, increasing x } For IncreasingSeparationAlgebra: Arguments R, J are implicit and maximally inserted For IncreasingSeparationAlgebra: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For Build_IncreasingSeparationAlgebra: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ function_scope]
